text: A coup d'état took place in Burkina Faso on 30 September 2022, removing Interim President Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba because he was unable to control the rise of Islamist insurgency in the country. Damiba had come to power in a coup d'état just eight months earlier. Captain Ibrahim Traoré took over as interim leader. Damiba was allowed to go into exile in Togo. ==References== Category:2022 in Africa Category:Coups d'état 2022 coup d'état Category:September 2022 events
title: September 2022 Burkina Faso coup d'état
